summary: A Vim plugin that provides a TextMate-like 'Bundles' menu.
name: Headlights
description:
Headlights is a Vim plugin that helps you manage your plugins (bundles). It shows you the plugins you have installed, and reveals their associated commands, mappings, and script files.

Headlights works by scraping Vim's internal commands and using Python to generate the fancy menus. (Tip: you need a version of Vim compiled with Python support.)

https://github.com/mbadran/headlights
install_details:
- Download the source archive.

- Expand the source archive in your .vim dir (I trust you use Pathogen).

- Add the following line to your .vimrc:

execute "HeadlightsTurnOn"

(This step is necessary to allow all plugins to load before inspecting them.)

- Restart Vim.
